default.value: (The heading is your opportunity to clarify the most important benefit. It should be specific, not generic.)
(This part is simple: Your call to action (CTA) should direct the reader to where they can go to get started (e.g. a link).)

(Describe how customers will discover and use what you propose, and the value they will gain from the solution. Your goal is to convince a reader that a customer will be compelled to try this solution. Include key features in the description.)
(Succinct explanation of the problem the customer is facing; tell the reader why they should care; specify the time, place and location your customer experiences this problem.)

(The opening paragraph; your summary should establish who your customer is, the overall problem and solution, and interest the reader enough to make them keep going. While this section is the first paragraph of your Press Release, many people find it's easiest to write this section last.)

(Fictional quote from a fictional customer. What would they say about your product? How will they use it and how will they benefit? Probably best to write this first so you are focused on the benefit to the customer. Don’t exaggerate or embellish. Create a sense of what the customer is feeling.)
(Get an appropriate quote from an internal VP or Director.)
